alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Dubois County through 215 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Jasper, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of up to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jasper around 200 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
